top_categories.workout_context: 62ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Gravelista's Victorian rolling, Australian gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 80 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gravelista's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before October.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravelista. Train it until it feels boring.
At mile 60 of 80, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
At Gravelista, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
5,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gravelista, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 80 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 5,000ft of climbing on victorian rolling gravel does to your power file on race day.
5,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on victorian rolling gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Gravelista’s 80 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravelista requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on victorian rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: victorian rolling, australian gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 80 miles of victorian rolling gravel in Victoria, Australia.
